im a fan of 1st person graphics and a sucker for eye candy somehow project zomboid manages to be incredibly immersive and entertaining without all that great attention to detail from the way injuries work to the sound system and from cooking and crafting to combat the construction system is a little barebones but using it for base building can be a great part of the game finding a spot that suits your needs building it up fortifying it keeping the zeds off of it storing all your stuff the game has a ton of stuff wide varieties of tools food medical supplies clothing weapons all sorts of other miscellaneous items almost all of it has some purpose in the game the combat mechanics take a little getting used to but work really well once figured out its important to keep moving while swinging your weapon in other directions it can take some practice recognizing exactly when its time to switch from fighting to running for your life to hiding theres a bit of a learning curve and it can be frustrating once i got the hang of it though i found the combat fluid and responsive in ways a more simple combat system wouldnt be the character system is surprisingly deep for a permadeath game ive yet to get anywhere near maxing out a character in anything but vegetable farming i dont know how much more content theyre planning but it plays like a content complete game and i havent had any issues with bugs or crashes all in all i highly recommend this one if youre into the openended sandbox survival genre especially if youre into zombies too

fun simple game you have two basic abilities right mouse click  grab the purple stuff with your hook and keep it pressed to roll of it gaining momentum and height left mouse click    punch people with your fist to throw them off there is the lobby map where you can learn the basics get some achievements and wait for more players to start the real game you need to go into the alien portal need at least 2 players for it to actually start a game though in there you can choose from 3 types of maps each with some more mini maps it seems in order to actually play the game gameplay super simple and straightforward fun game you can play online vs other people lots of servers so you dont need to fear lagging but as the game just came out there wont be much people in at the moment so best to play with some friends i enjoyed just playing vs random people so should be really fun with friends graphics what you see in the pictures is what you get i didnt think i would like it at first but its actually fine sounds fine achievements some you get from just playing the game some you can get as a single player just opening a lobby some you have to get when playing vs others like winning a game but the achievements are easy to be honest having achievement in a game is always a plus d additional informationnotes to the developers there is no chat i dont care about voice chat to be honest and with friends you have discord and stuff but for playing just online vs other people i would love to have a chat so i can say lol when i fail and jump to my death say gg when game is done etc tldr fun game to play with friends and pass the time kinda unique in its own way and has nice achievements should play for sure d

text: this game is cool but it is waaaaaay too niche to recommend unless you like very complex slower paced sim type strategy games  i have been trying to play it and its just too complex for me to really get into  i would dig it more if things were simplified alot more  i thought this would be kinda like homeworld but with more detail and no ship building  but this is more of a sim type game with tons of detailed systems which i found daunting to figure out  i honestly just dont have the time to invest in learning all its nuances the way commands are issued and moving on the 3d plane can be very confusing and difficult  trying to aim the ecm and make way points accurately is a nightmare  the way electronic warfare is implemented only exacerbates the difficulty in movement and clutters the already insanely cluttered ui even more  also path finding is non existent as your ships and ai get stuck on asteroidsobjects and cant navigate around them unless you manually give way points  imo the biggest weakness for the game is the controls and i found them overly complex and difficult to figure out partly because there are just too many systems to manage this is a cool game and i recommend it for patient strategists who like detailed sim elements  but realize its extremely detailed and not for everyone  i watched several gameplay videos and thought it looked really cool but the reality of using the controls is what holds the game back for me  either way i dont mind supporting the devs because what is here is actually really cool and original even if its not my cup of tea

it doesnt make sense that this game has overwhelmingly positive reviews  im sure many reviewers are overlooking certain aspects of this game  as a heads up completing the tutorial and maybe a single match will put you near or over the 2 hour return mark so keep that in mind in theory this could be a cool realistic space fighting game  in reality maybe it is  and maybe thats my issue with it  the game is slow  very slow  example i started a match online and first 8 minutes not exaggerating was spent moving my ships  there was nothing going on nothing for me to do  i was just moving into the map  that isnt some odd one off thats nearly everytime i  dont know if the maps are too big or the ships are too slow but good lord its boring at the start  i could go on but at the end of the day  the game isnt all that fun  everything about the game is very basic theres very little depth theres very little going on its really boring maybe im not its target audience  i do like both rts games and action packed games though either works for me and a game need not be both  this is neither

oh boy do i wish steam have a neutral button but here i go anyways excellent gameplay and great conclusion to the trilogy narrative wise and i have to commend the devs for cutting almost 100gb off the originally gigantic size of the previous games combined and made it much more compact in the legacy pack very useful if you want to play all 3 games without clogging your storage space on one note however  get it on sale when its half its price which i did the price is too high for a oneyear old game  the third parts levels feel much more linear than the previous games with less various stuff to do in the maps berlin is an exception i found chongqing and carpathian mountains particularly egregious for this  connecting to the hitman server seriously this is a singleplayer game had lots of these moments during crucial moments in my gameplay and it was honestly really frustrating didnt buy the dlc and im not into vr so i cant say anything about them

store page information about the purchasing options could be clearer i had to research what version to buy instead of making my decision based on the information provided on the steam store page account transfer from my io account could also be more intuitive but seeing as i had no issues moving my account data from hitman 2 steam to hitman 3 steam i have no further criticisms base game is excellent highly recommended but not for the full price

legacy access pass guide accessing legacy content is a little convoluted if you purchased hitman 1  2 previously the full versions not the free demos or whatever you want to make sure that youve installed both hitman 1  2 gotten to the main menu of the first game then gotten to the main menu of the second game you can quit out of the first mission this just needs to be done at least once  this will unlock the hitman 1 legacy pass for the 2nd game then you can load into hitman 3 and should see all the content in my case i purchased both games on sale since it was cheaper than the legacy packs for hitman 3 when it came out on egs  and never actually played 12 on steam  the egs version had a different way of seeing your ownership ignore that site for the steam version review if youve played hitman 1  2  3 is basically just more of that with slightly larger missions  i enjoyed it and would say it was worth 90ish dollars or whatever the total i paid for all 3 games was my only real issue is how they have multiple versions of the legacy passes and such listed on the store  and dont clearly list instructions on how to get them for free if you own previous versions  the information is out there but in steam guides for the previous games  its easy enough just play the previous 2 games once  but having to download 160gb of games just so the server can see that you own them is kinda meh

text: having spent quite a bit of time back on the ps3 this game is ironically one of my favorites of the series i really like the enhanced movement control options and various features such as the quick shot melee combat and countering capabilities however while the story was neatly layed out from different perspectives the game lacked everything associated with its survival horror roots the lack of weapon customization that was featured in re4 and 5 was a let down but was more than compensated with various melee combat options and countering capabilities the little customization that the player has is in setting up eight different triplets of skill slots that they purchase and upgrade skills throughout multiple runs of the game these were nice but i wish there was room for just one more due to the difficulty in escaping from various enemy grab attacks as far as weapons go each story includes various weapons that are acquired throughout the first playthrough and remain unlocked after that the use of grenades has also been mapped much better to quickly and efficiently get to and use than in the other games another great enhancement is the dying status being upgraded from the way it was in re5 that allows the player to defend and escape death without aid though at a disadvantage the overall presentation of the game was very well done and had very good graphics the levels were in some cases less enjoyable the way they trapped you in a smaller section at a time and blocked the ability to backtrack one of the most annoying aspects of the game was the interactive movie events or at least some of them that wants to cause great wear and tear to the controller to pull off in the limited time the last complaint would be in the numerous achievements that are attached to the various verses modes that few likely played to begin with given that resident evil has always been a singleplayer coop game overall the game is stylish and fun and the pc port seems to run perfectly fine the gameplay is more action oriented and less survival horror but the movement and combat options are in my opinion the best this franchise has ever featured in any of their games if you like these games then you will likely enjoy this one for the game it is however if it must be survival horror then you may be let down by this one
honestly re6 is a very fun coop game with another friend to play with yeah it drops the horror aspect of the game but man is it fun

learning to play is quite the adjustment but once youre past that small hurdle project zomboid is an excellent game prepare to suffer and die many times while also watching your friends suffer and die in horrific unspeakable ways enjoy the anxietyattack that is leaving your house to find foodcigarette lighterbed sheetssledgehammergas cantrash bagetc  everything you once took for granted before the zombies took it all away from you weep silently as you find yourself stripping boxers bras speedos and panties from the undead youve defeated so that you can craft sheet ropes or otherwise use these garments to bandage your wounds and last but certainly not least prepare to feel the sinking pit in your stomach as the dreaded queasy moodle appears on your screen announcing that the scratch or laceration youve recently acquired is slowly turning you into one of the undead may your suffering be sweet

this game has such great potential and it is probably going to be a dd classic the likes we havent seen since the 90s   thats if it actually does get launched  its been almost 2 years since it went ea and to be honest  outside of a few classes being added there hasnt been much movement  i mean your max level is 4 and you still havent produced all the classes   modders have mods they have made and left due to it getting old that work perfectly that both give you a max level of 20 and add all the classes  these are modders for goodness sakes and they are making the developers look like slackers  if this was an indie developer and it was their first attempt at a triple a game then i would say take all the time you need  but this developer has 2 cash cows on their resume that are still spewing money   do i want a rushed product of course not  but this is not a development team learning the ropes for the first time  they have proven skills and team members   this is also not their first rodeo  had this been a genre they they are attempting for the first time then yes a long development process would be understandable to put this in laymans terms its like chevrolet saying they need more time as they are having issues on figuring out how to make a car now if it was a boat or airplane i would understand  but its another car and not only that its a model you have been making for years now and only need to expand on what you have built in the past once the game finally goes live i am sure this will get changed to a thumbs up   but for now i just cant recommend anyone spending money on it  i am sure larians bank account will not notice so go spend that cash on an indie developer that could use it and has proven they love what they are building   example solasta  dd ruleset  max lev 12 and still more to come and it has the ability for you to create your own adventures as dd was meant to be

trip in another world is a fairly unique take on the clash of clans genre with idler gacha elements but less focused on constant pvpterritorial warmongering and more towards cooperative gameplay mainly with your alliance members the game itself is pretty boxstandard the game frontloads you with tons of resources to get your city and army started quickly and slows down considerably after a few hours of intensive clicking however at its current state i cannot in good faith recommend it firstly the game appears to be a lazy mobile game port of the title lord of the other world its a literal carbon copy of it with little to no discernible difference however there is zero optimisation made to improve the pc experience every single action is performed with just your mouse essentially acting as a glorified finger as such some actions are quite annoying to perform like having to click and drag your mouse to scroll etc something that could be easily fixed by introducing keyboard shortcuts but alas there is also ui bloat which is fairly typical of mobile port you also cannot change the game resolution again alluding to the lazy port i mentioned earlier the only game settings you can change is language partially music and sound secondly a severe lack of easily accessible information about the game the translation itself is not very good resulting in some awkwardinconsistent translations in several aspects of the game like skill descriptions etc which can result in very confusing descriptionsexplanations in the tooltip this is further exacerbated by the game having a ton of different mechanics such as status effects like vertigo ridicule arms restraint what are the differences between the different types of healing bloodsucking treatment first aid etc the different types of basic attacks like detonation pierce strike etc just to name a few yet none of it is explained anywhere about what it does and how it works so youre just left to do a best guess of what it does and hope that your guess is right thirdly there is no confirm button for gem purchases if you accidentally click on something that costs gems usually accidentally because navigating the ui is torture your gems will just be consumed with completely no option to toggle a confirmation window overall the game is alright typical of a idle gacha with strategy elements built in there arent any predatoryaggressive microtransactions either for now however the game in its current state needs a lot more polish particularly for points 2 and 3 unless those gets fixed and the overall pc experience is optimised i cannot recommend it as of yet

bugType: lack of information, invalid graphic representation
text: well if you ask me its not really that bad but it needs a lot of polishing i suggest this game if you like playing games like rise of kingdoms on mobile phone this game is almost like rise of kingdom exactly but they were a little bit more innovative in terms of some base content and best part its on pc but it feels like a phone game to be really honest what this game need to improve are hotkeys hotkeys are almost not present in this game which is really annoying as you have to click using your mouse to do everything so i really hope in the future it will add more hotkeys so that playing the game feels more easier and using the keyboard way more more rather than the mouse since its a pc game not a mobile game the only hotkey i found in this game was esc which when you press it it will ask you whether you want to exit the game or not warnings this game have an economy called gems which is to buy speedups and some other good stuff but its quite hard to get but its earnable so sometimes its really annoying is that if you accidentally press something that require gems and it does not give you a single warning to confirm that purchase so rip gems that you have been saving i really hope they add a confirmation button so that we dont mistakenly press and feel depressed about it optimization within the city it feels alright for the most part and pretty smooth i would say the problem that i find was that the layout mode its very hard to arrange your things nicely and in order because the grid that they provide is hardly accurate so i hope it will be more accurate in the next few updates so that arranging things would be much easier  now outside of the city i dont like the path of our troops  when we set them out as they cant go sideways but only left right straight or backwards which is pretty old school and doesnt really feel good at all one more thing that i must emphasis on is the zoom in and out key i wish that you could add the feature that we can use our mouses scroll wheel to zoom in and out this is really annoying because i always have to use my touch pad on my laptop and the sensitivity is very low i also hope you could let us zoom out into our field and the world easier so dont have to tap the button always to go out of our city i also suggest adding more settings options to make game play experience better and suit our liking as the settings we ahve right now is very limited graphics okay graphic wise withing the city can be better but its already great enough and im satisfied enough with the graphics within the city only but when you go outside of the city i feel that the objects are a bit oversize and does not look very good i do hope you improve on it your character graphics are spot on 5star for it but when we set them out they dont look really great and the troops they are leading are very plain and look very unmotivated needs improvement on that as well and hope the characters look as good as the picture showsthe world map feels like its 2d but i hope itll become 3d  so its much much much nicer animations this is the worst part i would say the animations its either its ugly or none at all i hope in the future you would make better animations especially on our character skills the movement of our troops feels very awkward as well maybe because they are really oversize on the map i hope more effect will be added on to the game so that the game feels much more exiting and makes me want to play even more i understand it was a mobile game before but now your trying to port over to pc which i will give my text: i can see why everybody is salty i beat the game in one night i liked the story and enjoy having a few more levels but i dont feel like it is worth a whole new game price the dlc setup is horrible to you get nothing for the prices no new maps just escalations thumbs down for now but i do hear of a new game mode coming lets hope it comes with a new map or two the final level should not count as a map at all because it is so linear i have also been stopped several times mid level because of connecting to hitman servers thats pretty bad considering its a single player game i am also hoping in the new game mode they come out with that there will be some intense cqc between 47 and the other assassins that may or may not be in the levels some jason bourne cqc would be really fun making the button qte events do actual moves and push the fight into other spaces rock paper scissors if you are a fan of the series the few new levels are pretty well done and still pretty large the final level is very linear and short so it shouldnt even count as a map id say get the game on sale and on that  note if its on sale i give it a thumbs up and if not thumbs down

this is a really fun game with plenty to do with almost limitless replayability as long as u ignore the obvious lack of security and endless modders on gta online

a beautiful game the graphics and cutscenes are fun to watch the combat is fun and reasonably easy to learn as for the puzzles they werent easy to solve but they were fun to figure out definitely recommend if youre into adventure

this game reimagined what tomb raider is and i was concerned but the graphics story and the decision to not shy away from the survialist theme won me over a bargain at the price in 2022 i would say the graphics are slowly showing their age but nothing major

the game didnt overstay its welcome the game plays like an action movie its very on rails and pretty predictable thats not a bad thing but there are times where i felt the game leaned into it a little too hard to its detriment the action sequences are enjoyable the set pieces and environments are stunning and really carry parts of the game there were multiple instances where the game would take control out of your hands to autopilot a section that you are very capable of traversing yourself or unceremoniously ending a big enemies life without your interaction which while it didnt happen a ton it was a little deflating when it did overall a pleasant experience

if youre a fan of the uncharted series this is for you as its definitely the source of inspiration a lot of platforming and freedom to explore the ability to upgrade weapons and get perks as you level up gameplay wise tomb raider may have a leg up on uncharted but when it comes to the story the visuals and level design uncharted is still the superior game

bugType: object out of bound for specific state
text: best in the reboot series even to this day the game still holds up and looks modern with the foundation engine great graphics  good voice acting great setting no dlss tressfx hinders nividia cards even to this day sometimes lara will jump to the left instead of vaulting up when climbing leading to death

after playing through the game from start to finish i have to say that its a great start to a new trilogy that i only just got around to starting the game is written very well has compelling characters and features the weirdness we expect from a tomb raider game it is also an origin story for a new lara croft who goes from an innocent new university grad to a hardened adventurer who is determined to uncover the weird mysteries of the world her father told her about by the end of the game i had come to love the tight game play elements aiming and shooting with all her weapons was easy and fun upgrades were earned from adventuring and hard won fights that became very easy by the time i got to the final parts of the game the enemies use flanking tactics and will overwhelm you if you are not careful quick time events are littered throughout the game along with a few temples to venture into at your leisure the sound team did an amazing job with the music if the music cannot set the proper tone i cannot play the game and the musical score is very well done and very tonal for the setting of the adventure i would recommend anyone pick up this game and play if you like adventureaction titles it has plenty of action and a very good story as well
